page.title: 01THE UCKFIELD AREA.
page.content: Our 12 km square consists of one major town{Uckfield},surrounded by undulating farmland and wooded hills. Uckfield derived from "oaken field" has a population of approximately 10250 people. By the end of the century it will increase to 15000. Extreme traffic congestion exists on the A22 both in and out of the town due to the railway crossing,although the line no longer links Uckfield to the south coast.The new{by-pass}relief road will be completed by 1986 and is changing the landscape considerably, cutting through the farms and woodlands. {The River Uck}and the{Shortbridge {Stream}flow into the{River Ouse}that enters the sea at Newhaven. The local area supports many countryside activities.
